alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 6:48PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Albany County through 745 PM MDT... At 648 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Bosler, or 15 miles northwest of Laramie, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bosler around 735 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 292 and 301. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
